title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis (Sacramento Valley)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process involved a first informal email communication with the supervisor that I met at a conference and then he arranged a panel interview with his colleagues, which finally resulted in an offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Applied, and recieved a phone call a few days later asking me to schedule an in person or phone interview. Did the on-site interview, and they gave me a tour of the lab and asked me simple interview questions.
Interview Questions: What do you do to stay organized

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and worked very well and I was pleased with all the people. It was a great experience here. I am proud of the way they worked out. All of my time was spent with me in mind.
Interview Questions: How was my day going?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Applications start early so be looking well before you need the position. Interviews are fair but be prepared to answer questions about your qualifications for the position. My interview was on zoom but was during the pandemic.
Interview Questions: How are you qualified for this position?

title: ICC Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a 30 min Zoom Call with two ICC workers (one of them was the ICC Advisor for the section I was trying to work for) and one ICC peer advisor. It was short and they asked me about 5-8 questions I believe.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths/weaknesses? If a [insert engineering major] student came to you to ask you how to apply for internship opportunities, what would you do?

title: Student Dining Staff Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy phone call asking questions about how you are as a person, how you would deal with tough scenarios, and asking about prior experience. Seem to be hiring pretty often as they offered me job on the spot.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a difficult customer?

title: Junior Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: A committee of 4-6 people ask you various questions. Some questions I was asked was: How has your current role prepared you for this role? What experience do you have that makes you feel you'd be successful in this role? What are your short-term goals and long-term goals?
Interview Questions: What previous relevant experience do you have?

title: Photographer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: interviewers were not listening but listing questions that they had no knowledge about, so I could tell they weren't qualified to judge my qualifications for the position that was offered.
Interview Questions: what lenses would you use

title: Disability Services Exam Proctor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted remotely through Zoom by two people, who were really nice. It was quite long since they asked a lot of the general interview questions, mostly situational and behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: What are your greatest strengths and weaknesses?

title: Digital Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, and was sent an email from the HM for a Zoom interview, haven't heard back from him since. I assume the next step would have been an in-person interview. This was such a weird interview experience. The hiring manager reached out to me over a month after I had applied for the role. Even though the interview felt laid back, and the HM told me that he considered me one of his "top 10 candidates" and would "get back to me," I haven't heard anything since my interview with him over 2 months ago. I assume that the HM either found someone else for the role or he isn't in that much of a hurry to fill the position. Either way, it's a prime example of why folks flock to tech jobs over roles in higher education: the interview process is entirely too slow, the level of customer service in the hiring process is subpar, and there is no real sense of empathy of care for the candidate.
Interview Questions: How do you organize your day?

title: MRI Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Sacramento, CA) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was very quick, they had 2 HR representatives pre screen me before talking to the hiring interviewer. the interview was short and sweet and just asked what licenses I have.
Interview Questions: What are the licenses that you have.

title: Student Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: After applying, I was offered a job as a student food service worker without having to go through the typical interview process. I was hired right away and started immediately.
Interview Questions: I was not asked any interview questions

title: Graduate Teaching Assistantship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Very quick interview process, everything is clear and transparent. I had a great time during the process and it was fun to learn more about the company and the culture there
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working here

title: Library - Information and Resources Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy and fun conversation with the manager. The people are really chill and are interested in getting to know you. You go through several questions and receive an offer the next day or two.
Interview Questions: What is your past work experience?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: pretty easy process, and basically they just want to know you a little bit. Forgot took how long, 15-30 min interview process. Very friendly process, asked about previous experiences .
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself.

title: Business Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Great experience- no complaints. They were friendly and quick to respond to emails. I would definitely follow up after every interview. They were happy to see that I went the extra mile to email everyone individually.
Interview Questions: Why UC Davis? Why do you want to work here specifically

title: Community Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: The interview was asynchronous. It was conducted through Canvas Quizzes. Instructions and practice questions were provided to become familiar with the formatting. Only audio was recorded, not video. There were regular interview questions and behavioral questions pertaining to the position.
Interview Questions: What ideas do you have for programs for residents?

title: Outdoor Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was equitable and easy. I found out if I got the job soon after the interview. One round of interviews then job training. Interviewer was respectful. One issue is the poor communication.
Interview Questions: How would you make sure people felt comfortable.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Very Structured, the questions are the same for everyone so it is a fair and structured process.  You are interviewed by a panel and not individually.  Typical panel interview process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: talked with supervisor about job and expectations and it was very easygoing. she made me feel comfortable and we talked about availability. she asked me questions about previous experiences and if i had any other questions. she told me about her experiences in the job too.
Interview Questions: what is your availability? do you have experience with animals?

title: Barista Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: they didn't really interview it was an online application that I filled out online and then they did a mass hire for their coho staff. Overall very easy and didn't take much effort
Interview Questions: What are the uc davis principles of community

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: scenario question - you help tutor a student, Problem solving, Show step by step how to solve something. remember to speak clearly and ask questions to the person you are tutoring to gauge their knowledge
Interview Questions: Scenario question - u choose the question u teach the person

title: Member Service Attendant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: really smooth and went well, interviewer asked very complete set of questions to assess fit for the team, easy to follow, interviewer also was very friendly, panel style interview with multiple people
Interview Questions: would you clean the restrooms when asked?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: It was amazing. The website has great information about questions that will be asked. Made it equitable and comfortable. It was a panel interview and I had ro teach for 10 min.
Interview Questions: How would you go about designing a curriculum for a class?

title: Residential Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went by smoothly and efficiently, and I felt comfortable throughout the whole interview process. However, it took a long time to hear back from the employer, Most people utilize this job to secure housing for the upcoming school year, and since the decisions came out so late, those who were rejected were left scrambling to find housing at a time where there were little to no vacancies in the surrounding Davis area.
Interview Questions: What was a difficult situation that you had, whether it be at work, school etc., and how did you approach it to solve it?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: They asked the basic questions, (IE: Who you are and why you want this job, why would you be the best fit, what experience do you have, when can you start) along with a humorous one to see how well you'd react.
Interview Questions: Why would you be the best fit for the position?

title: Storekeeper Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview, asked a series of about 10 questions.  Questions were fairly standard and were mostly related to background and experience. Lasted about an hour, panel size was about 6 people.
Interview Questions: How does your background relate to the position?

title: Student Accounting Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: You come in and they let you in to the back to speak to the manager. The questions are basic interview  questions, considering that most applicants for this have never been employed before.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for in a manager

title: IT Architect V Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Sacramento, CA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was well organized. It was 30 or so questions with 2 minutes to answer each question.  However, even before the interview, the HR department demanded to send out online surveys to my references. After the interview, my references filled out online surveys. This effort was a complete waste since I did not get an offer. I am not sure about the need to bother references if you have no intent to offer someone a job.  
Also, the job description failed to mention the specific technology stack used by the department. I learned about the stack during the interview. I am sure it gave internal candidates a significant edge.
Interview Questions: Mostly technical questions related to Enterprise Architecture.

title: Intellectual Property Officer 2 Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: The first interview with a hiring panel of 6 members from various staff levels, if you are offered a second interview it will be with 2 - 3 office executives. If you pass that then they will invite you to a "coffee break" meeting with all available office staff.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a difficult situation describing exceptional customer service.

title: PhD In Statisitcs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: 30 minute interview. Asked very specific and technical questions related to math, statistics, and machine learning. The interviewers wanted to test the training and fitting of the candidate to the program. The atmosphere is very friendly, though the questions are somewhat tough to me.
Interview Questions:
1. Basic math concepts in real analysis
2. Topological data analysis

title: Energy & Engineering Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by 3-4 engineers over Zoom. They were extremely friendly and asked a few basic interview questions, including describing one of my past projects. The interview was more like a flowing conversation.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Mechanic Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: very casual, talked with the MUGA manager and was asked my previous experience in customer service and problem solving. was asked why I felt qualified for this role and my availability.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this role

title: Sales Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Very hard to get info, the hiring manager was vague and did not seem knowledgeable about the team, department, or overall organization. Underwhelming experience that was poor representation for the UC system as a whole.
Interview Questions: What did you do in your prior role

title: Data Scientist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with a panel of 3 people alternatively asking questions. Fairly informal. Nice people, repoire, and atmosphere.  Some hard but straightforward questions designed to test your knowledge. My read was they were all reading from scripts that they had prepared as they tried to winnow the pool of candidates down.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience in building machine learning models.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was very chill and made sure to keep me relaxed through the process. It was not a very formal interview as the person who interviewed me was a student who was looking to hire assistants to work under her.
Interview Questions: Future Plans and goals and whether this gig will get me closer to it.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Very nice people. Genuinely interested in my life, hobbies, and career trajectory.  Interviewer asked me why I wanted to work for UCD, what my major was, and what my postgrad plans were.
Interview Questions: What are your post grad plans?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Unit manager and supervisor ask about 10 behavioral questions/scenario questions. Interview took about 1 hour. They both went back and forth asking questions and asked for questions from me at the end.
Interview Questions: Time you had a difficult patient

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: One round. Super easy. Asked mainly behavioral and situational questions. Some technical questions about the position were asked. I only did one round. For a full time it is two to three rounds with a panel for each round of the interview.
Interview Questions: tell me one thing about it.

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: very upbeat and friendly. made me feel comfortable. questions were very scripted, they do not really go off script usually short simple answers are better. dont ramble. be confident, they dont expect you to know everything, just have an open mind and be willing to learn and take constructive critisism
Interview Questions: How would you handle conflict with another employee in a different department?

title: AAIII Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of 1 hour of questions. The panel was Profesional and friendly. The entire process was not intimidating at all. I was given a timeline as to when I'd hear back next.
Interview Questions: Tell us about why you chose us.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Interview took about 30 minutes, many behavioral questions. During end I was asked to translate paperwork  in different languages. Interview was a smooth process but took discipline and preparation. I had a list of 3-4 questions to ask at the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? What can you bring to the team?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA)
Interview Descriptions: It was great. As a result of covid, the interview process was completely virtual. Staff at the university were helpful throughout the entire hiring process when I was getting started.
Interview Questions: What would you like to work on when you join the lab?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: It was a question and answer thing. We were given questions about why I wanted to work there. I said I wanted to do research about chemistry. I talked about my goals to become a physician and publish.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at this place?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Was not complicated or a lengthy process to schedule, questions typical of entry level part time retail jobs or such, quick and simple, business casual was OK to wear. There were some follow up questions in an email too.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with unsatisfied customers

title: Technical Writing Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Online application, via Craigslist. It took a total of five days to go from application to offer. The pay was hourly, and required occasional travel which was rather simple. Excellent opportunity to explore career options and understand work life balance.
Interview Questions: There were no questions asked

title: CRC I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Sacramento, CA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview lasting about an hour. Panel included senior associates, manager and supervisor. Very open and honest about daily process and requirements. very knowledgeable and have a willingness to help.
Interview Questions: SAE and AE submission experience

title: Part Time Cashier Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Great, quick and easy interview. The people I spoke to were very nice and I enjoyed talking with them. They asked me relevant questions and gave me time to think about my answers before answering.
Interview Questions: Why are you qualified for this job?

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: We were scheduled for our individual interviews and asked common questions about our past experience as well as questions to gage our personalities.  This included questions similar to the normal 'If you could choose any....what would you choose', type of questions.
Interview Questions: If you could choose any....what would you choose and why type questions.

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Questioned on food safety.  Some of the questions were provided before you were called for an interview.  interviewed by the manager and supervisor.  Easy if you know about customer care and food safety.
Interview Questions: How would you solve a problem between employees?

title: Lab Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Met with the lab manager and had a standard interview. I was asked to talk about my background, explain what educational understanding I had of what was being done in the lab, and why I was interested in the position.
Interview Questions: Q: Why are you interested in working for this lab specifically?

title: Student House Manager Mondavi Center Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: 1 interview with two hiring managers. Very friendly and helpful. Interview included tour of the beautiful venue and a traditional interview. Questions were asked in a conversational manner.  After interview, I was contacted by the two hiring managers about the position.
Interview Questions:
How do you contribute to a team? 
Why are the performing arts important to the university? 
Do you have any questions for us?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: They answer quickly and are honest about the time they will get back to you! The questions were straightforward and I had time to answer each one without feeling pressured.
Interview Questions: What is an example of when you had to handle a difficult client?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: One interview and the interviewer let me know that I had the job almost immediately. Questions were typical behavior questions and there were no chemistry questions. Interviewer wanted to know that I could be trained and would follow direction.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Applications Developer II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Had a 2x1 Interview with a Developer and Head of Department. First round of questions was some boiler plate, mostly some open ended questions to allow the interviewers to get an idea of your thought processes and critical thinking. The next step I had was very refreshing. Instead of the usual online coding tests, I was given a take home project assigned by the lead developer. Once that was completed, I turned it in and that was my interview process. I hope that the take home project continues to be an interview step as I believe it better showcases an interviewees talents rather than generic online code tests.
Interview Questions: Some questions regarding API's, the questions will likely vary depending on what kind development work you are doing.

title: Undergraduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: I was selected by a Professor based on how well I did in his class. I would recommend really trying hard in some classes, and reaching out to research professors to see if they have any work they need to be done.
Interview Questions: My interview was mostly word of mouth. You should network if you want to work here.

title: Info Sec Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Great interview, easy to speak to, and learned a lot from the interview. I was able to ask a lot of questions and learn a lot about the culture. Great  job environment.
Interview Questions: What do you currently do?

title: Project Policy Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Sacramento, CA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied in November and didn't receive an email until mid way through January. It was an online zoom interview with three interviewers. They had a list of question up on the screen and you answered it accordingly. At the end, you provided a writing sample and references.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this position?

title: Athletics Event Fellowship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: The process started with a phone interview with questions. I was then notified that they were no longer filling the position because of COVID 19. I was told I would be reached out to if the position needed filling after all.
Interview Questions: What is your communication style?

title: STDT2 Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: The process was over Zoom and it was with three different supervisors who each took time to ask different questions. The interview process was a behavioral type of interview. The interview was scheduled for 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Q: Can you please describe a time when you had to come up with a solution to a problem at a job and how did it improve your previous job?

title: Student Services Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Responded very quickly after submitting the application. The interview was conducted by a panel of two interviewers. The interview questions were very straight forward. Got the result after a week.
Interview Questions: Describe your strengths and weakness.

title: Medical Scribe Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very straight forward for the medical scribe position. I did a typing test, and they asked me basic questions about my time management skills and how well I react under pressure.
Interview Questions: How do you act under pressure?

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: -group interview with 3 people and we were interviewed by two student managers in a conference room. overall not much pressure since they were also students, but make sure you still dress semi formally (friendly but still a little strict). we each took turns answering a different question. they also gave us more info about the next step in the hiring process.
Interview Questions:
-what is a strength you have (related to the job/customer service)
-what is your work ethic like

title: General Laborer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at UC Davis (Millinocket, ME) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: I filled out and sent in the application and they scheduled the interview but they scheduled it for the same day that I had another and so I had to cancel one of them.  They spoke alot about the job description and responsibilities and I was looking for a call to let me know how I did.  I never did get a call back because maybe they're busy.
Interview Questions: Where do you see your self in 6 months?

title: Financial Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: The process was fair borderline easy to get a job for the Peer Advisor position. If you know how to talk and sell yourself you'll get the job. However, look over their requirement and some interviewing tips will be beneficial before your interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time your solve conflict?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview process, applied online, received an email to have an in person interview and the rest is history. The interview was very formal and we went through questions easily found online.
Interview Questions: What type of experience do you have working in this field?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview went really well. I was interviewed by three people (Lab Manager, and graduate students). The interview was informal and took around 20 minutes. They ended up hiring 2 people.
Interview Questions: How do you keep organized?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: It was well organized and did not take a too much time.  A great experience for Aggies and current college students. The hiring process took a few days and went faster than expected.
Interview Questions: What is your work experience

title: Ticket Sales Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: An interview with the advisor of the sector and also the current employee coordinator that the meeting was on zoom, you will introduce yourself with backgrounds and what you hope to learn for it.
Interview Questions: How do you handle an emergency situation

title: Case Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Sacramento, CA) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was typical in the sense that they we had a phone call initial interview a follow up virtual interview and then a work component to be reviewed at the third interview.
Interview Questions: What are areas of improvement?

title: Campus Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, took a few weeks for my application to get processed as they look to hire about 30-50 new guides at a time. Was contacted via email to come in for a group interview (I was given two separate time slots to choose from). From there I was notified about half a week later if I was moving on. From there, you set up a panel interview which took about 10 minutes total. I was contacted a week later.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a difficult/angry guest?

title: Veterinary Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: MMI interview involves multiple stations of tasks or questions, the interviewer does not react or show emotion to your answers, you rotate between different rooms with a set amount of time in each room and a brief period to read the prompt for the room
Interview Questions: cannot disclose

title: Resident Advisor (RA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Asked about diversity and inclusion and some leadership experiences. Need to show and demonstrate open-mindedness with people all over the world and backgrounds, including sexuality. Always explain examples and also how to tackle conflicts and how you overcame those problems.
Interview Questions: Asked about diversity and inclusion and some leadership experiences

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very brief. The interviewer was very nice and attentive. The interview took less than 20 minutes.  They ask you questions about school and how many hours you could work every week, during the quarter.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Student Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Met with fellow employees and had a chat. Asked questions back and forth about the job and what I would do and they did. Each person of the panel had different questions that they wanted to ask.
Interview Questions: Tell me something something about yourself?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interviews are standard list of questions that is asked of all candidates.  It leave the committee very little room to get to truly know the candidate.    Some question are vague, and they can't clarify because they want all candidate to have the same experience.
Interview Questions: Popular questions now is something along the line of diversity.  "What does diversity mean to you and how do it contribute to this position?"

title: Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied on Handshake, a week later was contacted for a 1 hour in person interview. Was ghosted by them, so i am assuming i did not get the position.
Interview Questions: whats a challenge you have overcome and what did you learn from the experience

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: nice peeps with lots of sleeps looking for dem heeps searching for dem keeps. Only pure essential oil is diffused, and the diffuser is free of water, so oils retain their antioxidant action.
Interview Questions: what are your best positions

title: Dietetic Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: The interview was with three people and they were all very friendly. The questions were straight forward, typical interview questions but they wanted all of the responses answered in the STAR method. They wanted you to specifically label the situation, task, action and result, which felt like an awkward way to speak. They did give me a short written test in which they gave me a meal plan for a hypothetical patient and they wanted me to calculate the liquid intake.
Interview Questions: List 3 foods you can't eat if you're on a renal diet.

title: Tax Preparer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: First, submit the resume to their email. If selected, go to the interview. Panel Interview with only one interview. Four lead interns rotationally ask the questions. The interview lasts around 1 hour.
Interview Questions: Why do you choose to join Students in VITA?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: applied online. the interview was friendly and the professor i worked for asked basic questions about my prev experiences teaching and the courses i took as an undergrad. was hired after a week or so
Interview Questions: standard interview questions, how is your take on customer service, etc

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Was pretty quick turnaround. Questions provided beforehand, lasted less than an hour. There was 3 people on the panel and they got back to me a week later. Website doesn't match up with how the timeline moves fyi.
Interview Questions: Principles of Community question, position, time management, strengths and weaknesses, standard stuff.

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back. Most questions surrounded given scenarios and your reaction, and also questions about diversity and inclusion. They understand that you probably don't have the right answer since you haven't been trained.
Interview Questions: How would you implement a program to promote diversity and inclusion?

title: Logistics Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a really laid back interview. They simply asked questions about any prior job experience. They also asked if I was able to lift objects heavier than thirty pounds as well as if I was familiar driving any vehicles bigger than a sedan
Interview Questions: Are you able to drive? When can you start?

title: Student Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the manager that directly ran the coffee location I wanted to work at. Pretty straightforward. Questions regarding problem-solving and why you would like to work at a coffee shop.
Interview Questions: Have you had a conflict with a coworker in the past and how did you react to it?

title: Finance Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Brief phone interview with supervisor, in person interview with a 3-person panel, final in person interview with CAO. I felt like they could've shortened their short list so that I wasn't called in if they were not interested. I did not receive an update but believe they filled the position
Interview Questions: How did you take initiative to go above and beyond

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and straightforward. Really professional and diverse panel of interviewers. I felt very confident and enjoyed the interview process. I felt comfortable to ask questions at the end of the interview as well.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Submitted an online app which they never acknowledged receiving or bothered to respond to. They state online that you will be updated throughout the process, but mine and my two friends applications have said “in route” for more than 3 months.
Interview Questions: Why Davis

title: Donor Relations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Davis (Sacramento, CA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: There was a panel of five people for 1st interview.  The 2nd interview was a one hour one-on-one, another 5 person panel, and a tour.  I had about 3 weeks between the two interviews and didn't hear from them again for about 5 weeks.
Interview Questions: Give us an example of a time you provided excellent customer service to a donor.

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview questions are straightforward and community based. You should know what your goals and visions are for using the position to serve the community. They send you a document of the questions an hour ahead of time for you to prepare your thoughts ahead of time and encourage you to take your time if you need it during the interview. As long as you are thorough and specific about your vision, you will be able to communicate well why you fit in with the position.
Interview Questions: Q: Tell us about yourself and why you are interested in serving the community with (insert position name here). How have your educational and work experiences prepared you for this role?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: It's a phone interview. Pretty straight forward, they ask my previous experience, why I want to work there and such. All are questions easy to answer. Find nothing too complicated.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: I was selected for getting a high grade in general chemistry. I scheduled an interview time that worked for me. It was a group interview with 3 other tutors applying.  Fast turn around
Interview Questions: they ask you to give a mini lesson to other tutors in the interview

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an interview weeks later. The interview was a panel interview. The entire process took 1-2 months and I received notification of an interview via email.
Interview Questions: They asked basic questions regarding leadership experience. i.e. What have you done to do ______?

title: Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and heard back over a month later. 2 full time research engineers interviewed me in a typical interview setting. General STAR questions and the usual why do you want to work here. Couple technical and hands on questions/problem solving that was on the trickier side.
Interview Questions: Can you explain how an air conditioner works? If not, what steps would you take to understand how one works?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by an in person interview. Two people conducted the interview but only one asked questions. It seemed more like a formality rather than if they cared about my answers. I also was able to tour the facility
Interview Questions: Can I work outdoors in a range of conditions

title: TA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by the professor and the chair of the department. Asked about related course works and thoughts about the course materials. Not really hard, but try to show the communication skills and good personality.
Interview Questions: What do you plan to cover in your discussion?

title: Staff Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Dublin, CA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview with the employees/supervisors. It was fairly short, probably 30 minutes. I also got a tour of the laboratory where I would be working at if I were chosen.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. Why did you apply for the job.

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: There is no formal interview process. It's an open application with  training sessions. If you choose to accept, you will go through training and onboarding appointments and start within a month.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Department of Chemcial Engineering Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Really laid back, told them about all of the tutoring experience I had and they saw the grades I got in my classes.  As long as your chill and show that you can talk to people you’re fine.
Interview Questions: Do you have any tutoring experience?

title: SAIV Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: A simple discussion about the reason for application and your passion. Easy conversation without too much pressure and some written questions to answer at the end of the process for you to answer carefully
Interview Questions: Why did you want to work here and what is your passion for the work

title: TA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: You need to contact a professor and/or committee to look for open positions. Interview depends on the professor and can vary a lot. Mine went pretty smoothly.  I just showed up in semi-formal wear and did the interview.
Interview Questions: What are your teaching experiences?

title: Academic Advisor (Major) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Five-person interview panel, some of the interviewers unfriendly/seemed uninterested during the process (one was openly hostile), asked questions irrelevant to the job duties, did not get back to me during timeline provided.
Interview Questions: How would you tell a student they were being dismissed from the college?

title: Junior Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Sent my resume, after 2 weeks I received an email saying they'd like me to come in. Very upfront about the position and responsibilities, interview was somewhat casual, just discussed my skills and what the work environment would be like
Interview Questions: Do you like job

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Just a brief talk with the lab manager. She also showed me the lab and went through the project that they were doing and what I might do if I were hired.
Interview Questions: Most about your past experience

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview and took about 20 mins. Basically, there were general questions about yourself and a few scenario questions. Not a hard interview, but I would recommend being prepared.
Interview Questions: What is your weakness?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview. I applied to be work at the silo peets. Talked to the manager and the whole process was about 20 minutes. Pretty general questions and was easy and quick. The manager was really nice and easy. Did not feel nervous at all.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview. It was offered as a condition of my enrolment for three years and has been renewed every year thereafter. Working conditions are better than the Union would make you believe.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: It was a typical PhD interview. During recruitment, we had two days of interviews, a data blitz where some professors spoke about their work, and some tours of campus along with some social gathering with students and a recruitment dinner with presentations. All in all, it was a 3 day process. However from application to acceptance is more like half a year.
Interview Questions: What interested you in UC Davis?

title: Student Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions:
1. You apply online through Handshake.
2. You get an email/call to schedule for an interview. They will ask for your availability in terms of class schedule and other commitments outside school. 
3.  You show up to an in-person interview. In every part-time interview I've been in there's usually a career staff and student manager present.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little bit about yourself.

title: Communications Specialist III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Three people interviewed me. I wasn't very confident about my answers, but I was offered the job. The background check wasn't as extensive as it is for UC Davis Health.

I wasn't trained, and when I tried to participate in meetings to learn about our initiatives, I was chastised for coming off as aggressive. About a month into my I was also a part of a panel interview for another applicant for a media specialist. Two people were interviewed and tasked with an assignment. The first applicant was white and completed the assignment. The second applicant was black and completed half of the assignment, but still, the Communications Director admitted to strongly considering the second applicant because "he would have been great for diversity".... They don't really work hard at the university... they just want a round table discussion about everything to make sure "everyone feels included." It's cute. I didn't stay long.
Interview Questions:
Can you describe a situation where you had a disagreement with your supervisor, and how you resolved it?

Have you ever been asked to do something you didn't know how to do? How did you handle it?

How do you handle a challenge at work?

What is your ideal management style?

title: IT Service Desk Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied on Aggie Job Link and got an email asking me to come in for an interview. Interviewed with two supervisors. Was just asked general behavioral questions and questions about how much you know about technology.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with an angry user?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 9 months. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: This is completely different for everyone who is interested in a postdoc position. My experience was similar to that of a junior faculty interview experience, it was a little overwhelming and I met a lot of people but it was good
Interview Questions: I was asked many questions about my previous lab exprerience, etc.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The interview went real well with a panel of 3 people. The manager, a staff, and one of the higher boss. It was a round of 10-12 questions of behavioral questions and experiences. It seems to be going well but the higher boss didn't seem a bit interested.  They did a reference check which took over a good month. After that never heard back from the manager until I follow up with an email. I was the longest process ever. Overall I glad that I had the experience.
Interview Questions: How do you communicate with a patient that has a language barrier.

title: Environmental Health & Safety Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position through Aggie Job Link. I got a response back in less than a week to schedule an interview. During the interview, it was a relaxed setting. Very comfortable and the interviewer (now my supervisor) was welcoming.
Interview Questions: Have you taken a chemistry course?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a personal interview with my potential advisor followed by a visit to potential research sites, and a discussion of potential funding avenues. This was all in-person on campus during the week.
Interview Questions:
What were my research interests?
What was my science experience?
Had I organized field sampling before?

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I submitted the resume via the UCD Library jobs and was called for an interview. A panel of three people interviewed me for the Carlson Health Sciences Library student assistant job. They were friendly and did not make me feel nervous.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation in which you had to help a customer at the library.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Clinical questions were asked. The manager of the unit and some staff RNs were present in a panel interview. Preset questions and they took turns. Quite serious tone. toured the unit afterward
Interview Questions: Ventilator is alarming, what do you do to figure out why

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, than in person interview. It was very relaxed and open. The people were very nice and cordial. Mostly they just asked about my past experience, then asked if I would like to do the job they described. It is important to be truthful with yourself for a job like this, because in 6 months you will hate it if you don't like the job to begin with.
Interview Questions: Past Experience

title: Fundraising Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: online application, then did video interview with a panel of staff. Very professional and a friendly, warm team. They communicated in a very timely manner and were always available to answer questions.
Interview Questions: was I willing to relocate

title: Service Desk Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions:
After applying for a position, I was asked to fill out seven questions form with two to four parts to each question.  

They set a deadline of less than two and a half days to fill out and complete the form 

The form took me over three and a half hours to fill out.  I wrote over one thousand words. 

Needless to say, after all my efforts I was never granted any form of a in person interview. 

I found this process disrespectful to myself and any other candidates that filled out this form. 

They said they had a large number of applicants to the position but having me basically write an essay for an application does not seem fair. 

It's H.R. job to vet candidates this process seemed like a lazy way around it. 

I'm applying to a Job not a Collage entry board!
Interview Questions:
Describe a situation when you were able to strengthen a relationship by communicating effectively.

In describing your example, please address all of the following:

a. What made your communication effective?
b. What was the long-term effect on the relationship?

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: you apply on the davis employee portal. it took about 30 days for HR to reach out and ask for an interview. i interviewd with two supervisors. the interview laster about half an hour.
Interview Questions: a list of tasks and in what order you would perform  them and why.

title: Partner Development Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted within a week of the job posting closing to conduct an interview. Interview scheduling was a pleasant process and highly flexible. Interview committee was polite and enthusiastic. Didn't get the job, but really appreciated the professionalism of the group.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Sacramento, CA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: It is the most stressful time  for me because it is my first experience in job interview. I was ask about presentation which I never had experience coz I don’t do presentations in my job as Operating Room Nurse ,so it’s kind of irrelevant for my job I’m applying.
Interview Questions: Why you leave your previous job

title: Undergraduate Education Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: It wasn't too bad. Be prepared to answer questions with confidence. It may take long for the hiring managers to get back for an interview and hearing results, which is the downside..the waiting game...
Interview Questions: What makes you stand out

title: Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: They had any interested applicant send in a cover letter, resume, and a set of supplemental questions to decide whether or not one would receive an interview. I did not make the cut for an interview or I did but I yeah
Interview Questions: What is your favorite thing in Davis?

title: Teaching Assistant - Computer Science Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions:
None really
Checked for eligibility in terms of coursework
I proved to then that I had completed an equivalent course earlier and they agreed to get me on board - paperwork did not take too much time either.
Interview Questions: Do you have necessary pre reqs courses

title: PhD Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The PI asked about previous work experience in similar projects. She also asked about the situation and current plans regarding my dissertation projects and wanted to make sure there were no conflicts with my major professor since the GSR position was not on my dissertation proposal.
Interview Questions: What was your role in the project you worked before this one?

title: Blank Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I worked in this position as a Temp through Temporary Employment Services, a placement program within UC Davis. I was interviewed and hired by the team I had been working with for more than a year.  Good experience.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Vacaville, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
Process took 1 month to get invited for an interview.

Was interviewed by 3 people. They gave me a copy of the questions asked during the interview a total of 17 questions.  Questions were pretty specific to the job your applying for. Some behavioral and situational. What made you interested in applying and how your skills can contribute. Everyone was very friendly.
Interview Questions: Asked about softwares/programs used. Situational and behavioral questions. Tell us about yourself. What made you apply and how are you a good fit?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Ordinary interview asking about experience and how to handle customer support. Checked to make sure student hours were flexible and made sure you were okay with possibility of short hours or long hours during different times of the year.
Interview Questions: 1)	Tell me about a time when you demonstrated leadership skills. What was the outcome?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Briefly described why I think I would be a good fit for the position. Afterwards, I was questioned about the information on my resume. Then, we began to discuss why I wanted the position and when I could start. By the end, he offered me the position and told me I would be receiving an email soon.
Interview Questions: Why do you believe you would be a good fit for this position?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very quick, was just applying for a summer job. The student assistant job at the graduate school of management was filled by me and two other people. All three of us were hired due to knowing the woman who was our boss through the Davis community.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have relevant to this job?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: I first submitted my CV to the professor who wanted to recruit postdocs. Then we scheduled a discussion via Skype.  The discussion was pleasant. I almost knew I would get the offer.
Interview Questions: Why you chose UCD?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Panel, very laid back, asked about things on resume, and used very general questions. Had to do a task related to position and you were judged based on that.
Interview Questions: How do you expect to contribute to the office?

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: sat down at interview table with current employees, asked a few behavioral/experience questions. wasnt very difficult. depends on who is actually interviewing you. good to just prepare off of basic interview questions.
Interview Questions: explain a time you faced something difficult

title: Upward Bound Instructor (Summer Camp) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Woodland, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I was asked to choose from 3 different dates to come for an interview. There were 3 people on the interview committee. At the end of the interview, the panel asked me to perform/discuss a sample lesson plan for 5-10 minutes. I had to provide exercises I designed myself.

When you show up, please take a seat in the lobby area, and the committee will call you in once they are done with the previous interview.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in tutoring for Upward Bound? What would you do with an unruly teenager? Why do you think you qualify for this position?

title: Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I sat down with two members of the team and they asked me a series of interpersonal questions to see how I am as an employee where some were geared to how competent I was. They were easy.
Interview Questions: How do you keep track of the tasks you need to complete?

title: Scientist Position Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview. Asked general question about the position and my experiences in the field. I was also asked about how to solve conflict and whether I have managed people before.
Interview Questions: How to solve conflict

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Half an hour long, around 17-20 questions. Expect general questions, situational questions, and questions surrounding diversity too. Dress business casual, and be positive! For first time RAs, you can ask your own RA to write your recommendation letter, so dont be afraid to make friends with your RA in the beginning of the year leading up to application season!
Interview Questions: You are on rounds, and you hear noise down the hall. When knocking on the door, you hear alcohol bottles and someone shushing others inside the room. What do you do?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a job at the bookstore online. I got an e-mail informing me that they sent my application to another student job area that was hiring. I scheduled an interview through e-mail.
Interview Questions: I was asked to elaborate on the things on my resume.

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was simple, with straight-forward questions. The first part involved a phone interview and next was an in person interview. They ask you to give a brief presentation on your previous work and meet the current lab and department.
Interview Questions: What skills did you learn from this project?

title: Sales Floor Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was emailed for an interview which was held in groups. It was held on campus at the store. Was asked past experiences regarding retail, class schedules and availability and future plans.
Interview Questions: What are your past experiences related to retail?

title: Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: A sheet of questions was given and you were allowed the answer them out of order depending on which question was easiest to answer first. There were two people interviewing you, and asked basic behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Demonstrate a time you communicated effectively

title: Membership Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Once application is submitted the interview is very simple usually with one of the managers and one or two student employees. They will ask you a series of questions and about your availability with classes.
Interview Questions: How would you describe Customer Service?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (New York, NY) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: There were two rounds of interviews. The first round was was a panel interview with 6 people who worked at the university. The second round consisted of 3 individual interviews with senior management.
Interview Questions: What were your past fundraising metrics and what did you do to achieve those metrics?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Received an email to schedule interview. The interview was friendly, the professor I worked for asked basic questions about my previous experiences teaching and the courses I took when I was an undergrad.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience working with flies?

title: Mechanical Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC Davis in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied through UC Davis, interviewed at the CLTC, standard interview questions with a two of the employees, met a few of the engineers, got a tour of the facility
Interview Questions: What shop experience do you have?

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was easy. First they interview you over the phone and then in person. There is also an exam you have to pass about the orientation in order to get the job.
Interview Questions: What do you like about UC Davis.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I emailed the professor and got an interview in 2 days. The professor is very friendly, he doesn't require me to have any particular skills.  He only asked if I was willing to learn new things
Interview Questions: Do you know how to use Python?

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty easy. Pretty much you're hired if you're a UCD student and/or referred by an employees. You would be working with over 300 students. You can request for a specific department but sometimes they'll just put you where they need you
Interview Questions: previous experience

title: Graduate Student Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through their website. I submitted transcripts and resume. I waited about a month to get back from them. I arranged interview schedule and since I was out of town, I did online interview. They asked few questions regarding previous experiences and attitude. They also asked me about my schedule for the quarter since the time had to fit to my schedule.
Interview Questions: Q: Introduce yourself

title: Digital Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: An hour long interview in front of a panel. Panel was made up of people from the department I was interviewing for and other areas of the company. Most of the interview questions were related to giving examples of experiences and my performance in other position. Nothing tricky or particularly challenging, you either had the experience and skills they were looking for or you didn't.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you used to data to redirect your marketing strategy

title: Compliance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I was called for a first round interview. It was a panel of three people. They were friendly and asked reasonable questions about my background and experience. I did not find the questions to be especially difficult. They are all relevant to the job description and could be predicted. It was a pleasant interview experience.
Interview Questions: How is your experience relevant to the needs of this position?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Received a call asking to schedule for an interview, then had the interview at the cubical of where my supervisor worked. Had a casual one-on-one chat rather than a full on interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Member Service Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview with gym director, along with a few other students. Dress professional but comfortable enough to pick up a 45 lb plate (which is needed for the job because you will need to clean up the weight room)
Interview Questions:
Would you be comfortable cleaning restrooms?
What is customer service to you?
Why do you want to work here?

title: Junior Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process was long, need to put in the legwork to get all the documentation together. Most academic hires I've seen is usually a referral, a volunteer or internal promotion. Unless that person is completely unqualified, the interview is usually a formality.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to this position?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Sacramento, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Panel Interview,  4 people (1 men and 3 women) , interview lasted over an hour, no conversation, they've reading questions from forms - same position different department, different people - same boring questions
Interview Questions: Describe a conflictual  situation and how did you resolved it.

title: Competitive Sports Official Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA)
Interview Descriptions: You were required to attend an initial overview clinic at least once for the year. Every quarter there were up to two additional clinics you were required to attend. There the supervisors would access your ability to officiate a game and the rules of the sport. Clinics often occurred late at night, not welcoming to most students schedules since these during the first week of school.  You could potentially attend an initial clinic from 5 to 6pm. Then not have anything until 8pm which could last until 11pm.
Interview Questions: What qualities or experience do you have which could help you as an official?

title: Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applying was really easy, just a resume and cover letter. There were three people on a panel taking turns asking questions, but they were all really friendly so it wasn't too intimidating.
Interview Questions: Q: What would you do if a student seemed in distress?

title: Junior Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Simple one on one interview. No stress, relaxed atmosphere. The process lasted about 45 minutes, with simple questions on work history and academic experiences. The process seemed fairly disjointed within the department, but generally the interview itself was well organized
Interview Questions: General school experience

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: everyone gets an interview, its the long process of training to upgrade license from class c to b. the training took around 3 months since there is a lot to learn.
Interview Questions: why be a bus driver

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Sacramento, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Panel Interview of 4 nurses including manager and assistant manager.  Questions are standardized and read off paper. Interview is point based. Had tour of unit afterwards, and was later asked to submit references by email that same week.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an nurse?

title: Student Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA)
Interview Descriptions: It was very quick process and done in a timely matter. The interviewer was straight to the point and ask professional questions related to the job. It was good to know that they also believed in the job.
Interview Questions: What is one negative experience that you've had in interacting with others and how did you overcome it?

title: Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview. So around 6 students were grouped in only 1 round of interviews. There was portion where we had to role play as advisors as interviewers were students. Another portion was a presentation.
Interview Questions: How would you support UCD principles of community?

title: Grant Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I was interviewed by a panel of 5 people. They were all very nice and they put me at ease right from the start so the interview was a blast. Half of the questions were technical, the other half situational. 
They asked about my related past experience, which aspects of the job were most/least attracting, a typical diversity question, etc.
Interview Questions: What was the most enjoyable aspects of a previous job?

title: Database Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very easy .If you have experience in the field in which you are applying then it is very easy . It took 30 days after the application submission to get call.
Interview Questions: why you want to join UC davis? What type of automation can be done to improve DB performance?

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA)
Interview Descriptions: One day visit. Research talk for 1 hour. Lunch and Dinner with graduate students. Tour of facilities in the university and the laboratory. Meet with the adviser and discuss potential projects. Very friendly and relaxed interview process.
Interview Questions: What is your long term goal?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Davis in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions:
From the start, planning and confirming the interview was relatively seamless, minus a minor mistake in which I did not receive the email with the information for my interview due to a clerical error. I went through two series of interviews. The first was with various directors the person who would be in the position would work with. It was a panel style interview in which questions were exchanged among the directors. I was asked approximately 12 questions and I was given time to ask questions to the interviewers at the end. From start to finish the interview was about 45 minutes. 

I was called the next evening and advised I was being invited to a second interview. Despite the same clerical error in getting the confirmation email with instructions, I eventually received the information for my second, panel style interview.
