Interview Descriptions: Simple one on one interview. No stress, relaxed atmosphere. The process lasted about 45 minutes, with simple questions on work history and academic experiences. The process seemed fairly disjointed within the department, but generally the interview itself was well organized
Interview Questions: General school experience

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: everyone gets an interview, its the long process of training to upgrade license from class c to b. the training took around 3 months since there is a lot to learn.
Interview Questions: why be a bus driver

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Sacramento, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Panel Interview of 4 nurses including manager and assistant manager.  Questions are standardized and read off paper. Interview is point based. Had tour of unit afterwards, and was later asked to submit references by email that same week.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an nurse?

title: Student Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA)
Interview Descriptions: It was very quick process and done in a timely matter. The interviewer was straight to the point and ask professional questions related to the job. It was good to know that they also believed in the job.
Interview Questions: What is one negative experience that you've had in interacting with others and how did you overcome it?

title: Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview. So around 6 students were grouped in only 1 round of interviews. There was portion where we had to role play as advisors as interviewers were students. Another portion was a presentation.
Interview Questions: How would you support UCD principles of community?

title: Grant Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I was interviewed by a panel of 5 people. They were all very nice and they put me at ease right from the start so the interview was a blast. Half of the questions were technical, the other half situational. 
They asked about my related past experience, which aspects of the job were most/least attracting, a typical diversity question, etc.
Interview Questions: What was the most enjoyable aspects of a previous job?

title: Database Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very easy .If you have experience in the field in which you are applying then it is very easy . It took 30 days after the application submission to get call.
Interview Questions: why you want to join UC davis? What type of automation can be done to improve DB performance?

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA)
Interview Descriptions: One day visit. Research talk for 1 hour. Lunch and Dinner with graduate students. Tour of facilities in the university and the laboratory. Meet with the adviser and discuss potential projects. Very friendly and relaxed interview process.
Interview Questions: What is your long term goal?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Davis in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions:
From the start, planning and confirming the interview was relatively seamless, minus a minor mistake in which I did not receive the email with the information for my interview due to a clerical error. I went through two series of interviews. The first was with various directors the person who would be in the position would work with. It was a panel style interview in which questions were exchanged among the directors. I was asked approximately 12 questions and I was given time to ask questions to the interviewers at the end. From start to finish the interview was about 45 minutes. 

I was called the next evening and advised I was being invited to a second interview. Despite the same clerical error in getting the confirmation email with instructions, I eventually received the information for my second, panel style interview. This interview was a two-and-a-half hour interview. I interviewed with three different groups the person in the position would be working with. I was also asked to do a presentation. The first of the three groups had a more traditional standardized form of interviews (ask questions and rotate the questions from one person to another). The second and third groups I interviewed with were less formal and more conversational. 

At the end of round two interviews, the hiring manager concluded the process and said we would be in touch after a decision had been made. Approximately one month later I was contacted and offered the job.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you were faced with an extremely emotionally charged situation. What did you do? What was the result?

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a panel of three people; an HR person, a direct supervisor to the position, and a head from a related department. They gave me a sheet of paper with about fifteen questions to review, and began asking immediately. The questions were mainly aimed at specific examples of past experience.
Interview Questions: They asked what three words my colleagues would use to describe me. They asked why I was interested, and what my experience with software was. They asked how I build relationships with the people I work with and what I think is important to being successful in the workplace. They asked for an example of a time I had made a decision without my supervisor present.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Hired based on application. Submitted to various departments. Got a reply from CHMS, the math dept., etc. simply stating that I was hired. Had to email back other depts. to find out the status of my apps.
Interview Questions: GPA, experience, etc. Nothing about teaching skills.

title: Graphic Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Fast and professional, the supervisors were all present during the interview and each of them asked questions, the whole process was light and easy, not too intimidating. The supervisors asked about 13 questions and gave enough time for me to respond without rush
Interview Questions: What is your strength and weakness?

title: Event Staff Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions:
Pretty straight forward group style interview with your direct supervisor(s) and a couple of the current staff leads. Come dressed in semi-professional wear.
Boys wear dress shirts and pants, tie is optional, nice shoes. no sneakers. Clean hair and overall look
Girls wear a nice shirt with no cleavage showing. dress pants/solid color jeggings. flats/dress shoes. low heels if you dont have the other shoes. clean hair up or down, doesn't matter. if you're wearing makeup, dont overdo it.
Interview Questions: Previous experiences with customer service. Biggest flaw. Why do you want to work for events.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: saw the posting on Aggie job link. Phone first in 2 days asking about my time slots and my location. Some standard phone screening questions since I have recently graduated to see if I am familiar with the subject matter. In person interview was more to see my knowledge about upper division Econ materials..
Interview Questions: How do you value your university life?

title: Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I've had a few interviews before and they've all been very casual. They always ask me about my previous experience. Most importantly, don't be too focused on the technical stuff such as listing your achievements and what you can do. Mention them of course, but since you'll be someone's assistant and you'll probably be working alongside them, that someone is generally looking for an assistant that they can get along with. So be natural and confident. Oh and ALWAYS have questions prepared. Not just basic stuff like what are my responsibilities, go on their lab's website and figure out questions based on their research!
Interview Questions: Do you have any previous experience?

title: Staff Research Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA)
Interview Descriptions: You have to make out a profile to use their online system. Once that has been done, you can look for available job listings. What's nice is that they keep you updated on the process if you check online. However, you never know if you get an interview unless they contact you directly. Once contacted, they set up a panel-interview where 2-3 people asked questions round-robin style. After the interview process was complete, they called my references. It took about 10 days from the time of interview before I was contacted about whether or not I got the position. After that, I went into the office and signed all pertinent paperwork and then began my new job.
Interview Questions: Aside from job-duty specific questions, they asked things like, what would your co-workers say about you, what do you find frustrating in a job, etc.

title: Chinese Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview is easy, they just want to make sure that you feel comfortable about being a Chinese language tutor  and you have enough knowledge about Chinese. A lot of their students are leaning very basic level Chinese, so you have to patient to these people. They have some very nice teacher at their language department . I took the job at summer and I help about 10 students about their speaking and writing. Overall good experience.
Interview Questions: what is your first and second language?

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a panel of 5 interviewees to 2 employers. They took turns asking each person a question for 3-4 rounds. Questions ranged form leadership to skills to personality.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths/weaknesses?

title: Student Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Interview with 2–4 staff members.  Staff members were warm and alternated asking questions; took notes during interview.  Most questions were related to the mission/vision, campus climate, and interpersonal skills/situations.
Interview Questions: How will you balance academic responsibilities with this position?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA)
Interview Descriptions: JUst a simple interview. I walked in and talked to the general manager. She was friendly and nice and was very interested what I had to offer. She made me feel very comfortable.
Interview Questions: what are your life goals? What is your major? why studying that major?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a position at a research study through UC Davis. I was contacted about a week later for an interview. The in-person interview was a panel of several people asking me not super difficult questions, and everyone was very friendly.
Interview Questions: Have you ever followed a strict protocol?

title: Student Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: A brief phone interview, followed by an in-person interview with a panel of two supervisors. Both supervisors were welcoming, and took notes during. The questions asked were situational and behavioral rather than technical.
Interview Questions: Have you taken any classes in our department, and if so, which ones?

title: Maintenance Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Sacramento, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very standard. They gave great direction to a hard to find office.  Almost by today's standard for all Human Resource Departments.  The employer looked at her laptop and filled in the blanks.  Very little interest if answers did not apply to the form she was filling out.  The process took about 30 minutes to complete.  Overall it was professional.
Interview Questions: If you have worked in a team and there was a team member that wasn't doing their share of work.  How did you handle this situation?

title: Administrative Assistant III (Temp) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Sit-down interview for about 15 minutes, followed by an in-person typing test and Microsoft Excel and Word skills tests. Overall, it should be easy for individuals who are well-versed in the Microsoft Office software suite.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with calendaring and scheduling meetings?

title: Energy Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by three or four people at the same time. They asked pretty basic questions. However they did ask a few technical questions regarding Excel. They will ask you if you had any previous experience working with large data sets.
Interview Questions: How well do you know how to use Excel

title: Student Assistant IV Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: This was mostly done through just an evaluation of prior experience, specifically the student's performance in a class required by the major (Senior Design). Past performance on graded projects were evaluated, most likely. Other factors that probably played a role were dedication to the project at hand, past interactions with the employer during group meetings concerning the project, and the overall turnout of the final deliverable.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Proposal Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was friendly, thoughtful and put me at ease. However, she failed to tell me one of the larger aspects of the job which I had to discover on my own.
Interview Questions: How well you can deal with office politics

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: One round panel with 2 senior managers and 1 recruiter and got notified 2 weeks later than they promised. The interview itself went well and senior managers gave positive feedbacks on the spot.
Interview Questions: How would you facilitate an on campus initiative?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was not very difficult or anything unexpected. I set up an interview, then met with each department head at one time. The leads of UCEAP, Operations, Enrollment and Peer Advising met with me to discuss my qualifications.
Interview Questions: Why are you a good fit for study abroad?

title: Fleet Services Dispatcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Brief, asked questions relating to an office environment and customer service. Some questions dealt with how you would handle situations or how you have handled difficult situations in the past. The interview had very easy, basic interview questions. The managers were very friendly and it was a great place to work as a student.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation were a customer was upset?

title: Student Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was short and took about 30 mins. It was a group interview with two other people. Two interviewers. The interviewers wrote down our answers. Every question, they would direct a new person to start answering it first.
Interview Questions: What is one of your weaknesses?

title: Student Assistant III Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was hired through Undergraduate admissions. The interview process was super easy. I was contacted by email and then scheduled an interview. After, I was notified that I was hired. The questions were straight forward and easy to answer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about any previous work experience.

title: Student Assistant IV Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Finding the position was simply via Aggie Job Link; simply had to apply for the position and provide my resume. While Aggie Job Link has its flaws (feel like applications never work), it allows for easy job searching for student positions. There were no additional interviews needed after the scheduled in-person interview, and I was notified of my offer within 1-2 business days.
Interview Questions: Prior experience for other campus jobs

title: Assistant Professor, Clinical Surgery Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Overall positive and simple interview process, video recording of self answering questions, and in person interview. Questions were fairly straight forward and they got back to me within days after the interview asking for my references. They required 3 references and after confirming eligibility, they officially offered me the position.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you had difficulty working in a team

title: Junior Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Applied Online. Was contacted about a month later for interview. Underwent interview process and was asked a lot of technical questions and how my current experience and education could apply to the position. Interviewed by a 5 person panel. Highly intimidating
Interview Questions: Please give an example of a difficult situation at work in which your interpersonal communication skills significantly improved the outcome?

title: Event Staff - Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: After you apply, your resume and cover letter is scrutinized by the student managers. Be sure your grammar is impeccable and your resume is clean and succinct. If you pass this portion, you are called in for a panel interview with the student managers and assistant director.
Interview Questions: They want to see you are an effective communicator and can perform under a tight schedule, be responsible and answer truthfully.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a great experience overall. The teacher was a little on the skeptical side regarding my ability to teach an upper level undergraduate course, but she was doing nothing more than her duty. She was very up front about expectations, and genuinely interested in making sure I would be a good fit.
Interview Questions: What classes have taken in this area?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Sacramento, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied via online portal, was contacted via phone to schedule in interview 4 weeks later. The interview consisted of a panel interview with ADMs, each taking turns asking questions.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you displayed leadership

title: Director, Research Compliance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Redding, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: This was a phone Interview. Asked very basic questions.I received an email letting me know that I had been selected for the first step of the interview process that was a phone interview. If I wanted to proceed I should respond to the email. I responded, the phone interview was set.
Interview Questions: The usual ...tell us about yourself. Why are you interested in this position? All straight forward questions.I did enjoyed the process. The seemed very knowledgeable and knew what they were looking for.

title: GSR Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions:
phone interview: ask some basic questions about what I am doing during my master degree
and my interests
also tell me the projects that I will be doing during my phd period
not difficult quesitons
Interview Questions: no difficult questions

title: Student App Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: You'll be asked about your personal interests, past projects. Nothing technical. They want to get to know you and you should ask what kind of position they are specifically looking for.
Interview Questions: Past challenges.

title: SASC Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: They first contacted me and asked me if I was interested in tutoring the class I took before and finished with a successful grade. I turned in my application and was invited for the interview where I had to lecture choice of  your subject for 5 minutes. My supervisor explained more about the job after.
Interview Questions: What would you do if your tutee does not understand the material after first time you explain to him/her

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Hiring process involved writing some essays and telling about yourself in your application. Everyone who submits an application will get an interview.
Interviews are scheduled online with one of the coordinators. All coordinators are very supportive in the interview and will let you take your time. You are expected to answer all questions (approximately 15) in one hour time. Read the job description to help you out for your interview.
Interview Questions: Situational questions regarding what you would do as an RA

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I met with three people who work for the executive that I would have been assigned to. It was a round robin style of questioning and was somewhat informal and very pleasant. Everyone was very professional and approachable.

We spoke together for over an hour and I was able to explain my experience, skills and interest in the job as it would tie together nicely with the demands of the position I was applying for.
Interview Questions: My experience that qualifies me for the role.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: My professor connected me to a PI leading a neurodevelopment study. Following this, I got unboarded and started working for the study for two point five years. That is all I have to say about this. I feel like this is now more than 30 words. Why does this need to be so long?
Interview Questions: Name a time you were given a difficult problem to solve.

title: Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very informal process.  They value soft skills, team work, and professionalism.  You must have a a strong self starter work ethic and proven persistence. You must also express knowledge and interest in the research.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to work with a difficult person.

title: Campus Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I brought in a list of accomplishments that was laughed at ( I think it got me the job though) and the interviewers said it wasn't necessary. The two people interviwing were nice and didn't ask many technical questions. Don't stress about it.
Interview Questions: What qualifies you to work here?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: They had me teach a lesson in any subject I wanted. I chose vectors and kept it simple, asking questions to the interviewer to keep them engaged, etc. Was graded by the interviewer and every candidate in the room became a tutor.
Interview Questions: Describe one helpful tactic you can use to effectively help a student.

title: Senior Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Working for the Information Center for the Environment required rigorous response to a host of questions related to public policies, programs and workplace preferences. Do your homework and review key articles by Project Manager staff and professors associated with ICE.
Interview Questions: They asked me to provide an example of working with advocates to use science to better inform their decision making process.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: it was a quick process, went in for an initial interview, lasted about 30 minutes with 2 people. Everything went smooth and they made the process super quick. I got an email a day later for a job offer and accepted it right there and then. Started training/working the next day. Overall a good experience.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the job and how will it help you in your career goals?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was an on campus interview for a consulting position. UC Davis hosted the employer. It seemed a bit rushed and the prospects weren't the best when there was a large line for the interview.
Interview Questions: What kind of experience have you had in this field?

title: Student Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Applied on Aggie Joblink and got an interview in about 3 weeks. The questions were all behavioral, not technical. The people are extremely nice about everything, so don't be nervous or hesitate to apply.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: AA III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was called for an interview a few days after the job posting closed. You interview with a panel of three people and they as many behavioral questions. I believe that they already have someone internal they want to hire and just interview out side applicants per policy.
Interview Questions: How to you handel multiple task with strict deadlines?

title: Student Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: First was a test on linux, you are testing with other students, about 40. Next is the one-to-one interview. At this point there's only 20 qualifying students. They ask you questions about experience and such. One of the questions they ask was how do you know if you talk to the computer on another network
Interview Questions: How do you talk to a computer on the same network?

title: Computer Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview, where technical questions were asked that could be asked during day to day tasks. Hiring took some time but once it was completed it was a pretty straight forward process.
Interview Questions: What is the sound macs made when they turn on?

title: Intramural Official Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process involved taking a multiple choice and free response test that covered basic rules and penalties of the sport. Students were also tested on basic hand signals and observed in a real scrimmage game prior to being hired.
Interview Questions: What is the penalty for a false start infraction?

title: Student Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: The initial hiring process with HR was very casual before referring me directly to a manager for an interview. The manager was also very comfortable to speak with. The hiring manager was very open to questions I had and they were quick in getting back to me.
Interview Questions: Will I be able to fulfill the specifications?

title: Baker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was hired by the Hr team and sent to Tercero Services at the University as a per diem employee. I impressed the managers and was hired as a career employee in under a month.
Interview Questions: How do you communicate with customers every day?

title: Mechanic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview, they make sure you know how to talk and have had experience using tools. Be prepared to talk about why you think you deserve the job, and why you fit the position
Interview Questions: Tell a joke at the end of the interview

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was really easy. I wasn't asked much of experience. As long as you really want the job you get it. They don't ask you too much on your experience but they do ask you more on the kind of person you are.
Interview Questions: What is a strength?

title: Technical Floor Staff III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Laid back interview with a panel of 2 members of middle management and a veteran student employee. Basic 10 behavioral questions such as what is your greatest weakness, if you disagreed with your boss with a method how would you go about it etc...
Emphasis on promptness and not being late, makes sense for a student employee job like this.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness and how has that affected you in a work situation?

title: Staff Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Standard questions from HR department,about 1 pages,10 question.And then talk about skills need to be used in the position.since it's a part-time position,they asked me if I understand the hours.
Interview Questions: how long you been working in this field

title: Student Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Asks the most basic interview questions, meant to prep students for future interviews. The office is on the 4th for of Mrak and is linked to the Vice Chancellors office, so you are in a position to make real change on campus. The Sustainability Manager interviews you in a small unused office filled with storage, using the room components as part of the interview.
Interview Questions:
1. What are you strengths and weaknesses?
2. What in this room could be reused or recycled. 
3. How would you make a peanut butter and jelly sandwich

title: Student Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Very informal interview, I heard of the job through a friend and contacted the employer directly, asking if they had any openings. When I went in for an interview, they asked me a few questions about my work ethic and gave me more info about the job. I took the job after the interview, filled out all the paperwork and was working within a week.
Interview Questions: None, the interview was very simple.

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Personal meeting in a national conference followed by on-site interview. I gave a 30 minutes talk about my past research experience and answered several questions. Had a lunch with senior lab members.
Interview Questions: Career plan

title: IT Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied on aggie job link. Received an email to come in for an interview. Came to the interview 10 minutes early. Interviewer was 20 minutes late.  Interview lasted around 20 minutes. After the interview got a tour of the building and met the current staff.
Interview Questions: Tell me about something you are an expert of and how it works and everything you know about it.

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: I contacted several PIs about graduate student opportunities in their labs and the funding situation. I had phone conversations with them about these opportunities before my interview in the spring.
Interview Questions: What are your motivations?

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was relatively quick. The interview was with two other people in the room and the supervisor and one higher up student employee. The questions were pretty general and they asked them from left to right and then right to left so everyone got time to think and it was fair. Still weird group interview.
Interview Questions: What’s a time you were faced with a hardship and what did you do to deal with it.

title: Student Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Pretty basic interviewing progress. Just applied online via aggiejob link. Had to do a group interview with around 5-7 others. Asked basic customer service-type questions that are typical in cashiering jobs.
Interview Questions: What's your greatest strengths and weaknesses?

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview with many other students and everyone gets asked the same question. You do not choose what section in the bookstore you want to be after you are notified that you have passed the interview. They will give you a slip where you can rank which areas you rank first. Before this, you are required to go through a background check so they can screen you. I do believe this is for Cashiers primarily as they are handling the cash in the store.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have pertaining to this job?

title: Undergraduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I sent my resume into the professor that runs a research lab I was interested in. Within a week she responded wanting to set up a face to face interview. During the interview, she asked some technical questions about composite materials (my focus in education) as well as general engineering questions. The main component of the interview was a lab tour in which she analyzed my questions about testing procedures and analysis. She wanted to hear thoughtful questions to make sure I had a good background in the material.
Interview Questions: Describe how unidirectional composites differ from isotropic materials when put under loading in various directions?

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions:
1. They will introduce what you will be doing in the job.
2. Then some very typical interview questions.
3. There are two interviewer for the whole process.
4. They will ask for your certificates(any kinds that you put on your resume).
Interview Questions: What kind of environment you would like to be working in?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Signed up through Aggie Joblinks. Received an email about a week later, asking for an interview. Applied for a dishwashing position. Expressed my interest in research, and was hired for a research position instead. Studied the lab beforehand ,in order to see what kind of techniques that they used. Expressed interest in learning those techniques during the interview.
Interview Questions: Are you a detail oriented person, or a result oriented person?

title: Postdoctoral Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I had skype interview with the PI, who asked me to present my previous work.
After that, I was asked a couple of questions regarding my work.
Then, I had chances to ask questions about the projects in the lab.
Interview Questions: Q: How many papers did you publish per year, and can you maintain that amount in the new work place?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by a board of about 10 employees. A portion of the interview is requiring the interviewee to teach material to the board. Following the teaching portion of the interview are behavioral/personality type questions.
Interview Questions: What qualities do you have that would make you most qualified for this position?

title: Junior Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: there was not hiring process for this particular position. I knew the PI and it was completely up to him to bring people on. Other positions, I know, are not like this.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant IV Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview process, streamlined and pretty straightforward. More of an evaluation really. Prior experience and projects were heavily taken into their consideration. Evaluation also focused on several things, such as: past projects and their grades, group projects, deliverables, learning outcomes, etc. Also, took into consideration past experiences working alongside the employer and fellow co workers.
Interview Questions: Evaluating past experience working on similar projects, etc.

title: Bike Mechanic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the ASUCD website with my resume. About a week or two later, they contacted me for an in-person interview. Simple questions were asked. What are your hobbies? Why do you want to become a bicycle mechanic? How is your schedule like? They are not extremely evaluative since they hire people with no experience. They hired me one hour later.
Interview Questions: None - no difficult questions for non-experienced mechanics

title: Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: All behavioral. Asked about public speaking experience, really just wanted to get to know you.  I did not find it challenging, since it seemed like they already liked my background which made me more laid back and comfortable answering the questions.
Interview Questions: How do you work with a diverse group?

title: Assistant II Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: My hiring process was interesting because I was already working as a temporary employee in the position I was applying for. So, this obviously gave me a rather huge advantage. I submitted the application according to the usual process and was interviewed by a panel of three people, two of whom would be my supervisors and one who would be a coworker, but not working in the program that had the open position I was applying for. The interview questions were fairly basic and not terribly difficult, but did require thoughtful answers.
Interview Questions: What attracted you to this job and working with this population of students (1st generation college students)?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: It's not too long, but the questions are really about what kind of person that you are and how you would handle specific situations. Be yourself and come in with a very open mind. Most importantly, Student Housing is looking for an individual who's both a team player and leader that's always willing to learn.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Career Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Meeting with Deans and directors
Interview Questions: How can you add value to this position.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Applied through UC Davis jobs website.  Was contacted via e-mail for 1:1 job interview.
Interview Questions: There wasn't any difficult question as this is only a student assistant job.  They were mostly typical interview questions such as - what are your strength and weaknesses, what are your hobbies, what is your class schedule.  There were no technical questions.

title: Warehouse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Just Talk to supervisor, and he will take you on a tour around the warehouse. 
Get to meet the employees, and get to see the environment.
Very Simple, and no trick questions.
Almost always guaranteed the job
Interview Questions:
Are you capable of standing for work
Can you lift heavy objects

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: i was recommend to work with a professor on campus. the interview process was very casual. the professor just wanted to make sure i was invested in the research he was doing. there was no formal interview process though. it was more of a chat and getting to know one another. i enjoyed the low stress environment.
Interview Questions: what are your interests

title: Student Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: The interview and hiring process was very quick. I signed up online, set up an interview two days later, and then received the offer a week after.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions. All are very basic interview questions to ask.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UC Davis in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: They gave me a phone call and scheduled an interview in their office. There were two interviewers, one is the manager, another one is a current student assistant. It was a relaxing interview, only asked behavioral questions and what are my hobbits.
Interview Questions: The first question they asked kinda scared me: what do you know about plant science. I didn't expect that because I am a computer science major and I applied for an IT position. Turned out this question doesn't matter that much.

title: SAII Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Informal, pretty easy.  They did it in the DC when they were closed.  It was more of an overview of what you were going to do.  They were in need of people when I came so it wasn't very picky.  Bunch of people left so the "interview" process was less screening, more training.  It took them a month or 2 to get back to me, and another month or so to get me in for the interview.
Interview Questions: Availability

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interviewing process is handled directly by HR. They contact you and set up a meeting with your future department, if not, interview you themselves. Everything goes pretty smoothly by schedule. After your interview it takes about 3-5 business days for them to reach a decision. The interview was business casual, I didn't need to wear a tie. If you do get hired for the job, you have to attend a mass hiring signup event where you do a bunch of paperwork to become a university employee.
Interview Questions: What your GPA is and why it isn't higher.

title: Junior Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Hired by Internship Career Center, UC Davis website post. Got an email the next day to come in for in person interview. Had a one on one interview with multiple people in the lab. Introduced to everyone that I will be working with. Talked about projects that they were conducting and if I was interested. Got an offer during the interview.
Interview Questions: What type of experience do you have?

title: Programmer II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the UC Davis website and was contacted via email to schedule an interview after about two weeks.  The interview was with a panel of three people.  It was a pretty relaxed and light-hearted atmosphere, overall.  After a single interview, I received an offer after a few days.
Interview Questions: A good deal of definitions and terminology tested rather than coding ability.

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Hiring was fairly straightforward. Applied on the job portal on the website and heard back from them a few days later. Regular interview with 3 people and they even gave me the questions they were going to ask beforehand. It lasted around 30 minutes or so. Called me back a week later about the results. Practicing regular interviews helped a lot and they asked pretty stereotypical questions (experience, greatest weakness, etc).
Interview Questions: What was your greatest weakness?

title: Campus Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a three step process of a one-on-one Q&A with someone on the recruitment team, a fun group Q&A of personality and situational questions, and a one minute video recorded message of why you would like the position. Overall, they look for well-spoken people who are confident, but also authentic. Enthusiasm does well here, as well as enunciation and volume.
Interview Questions: Situation: A student on a tour asks if college professors are better than high school teachers. How do you answer?

title: Marketing Student Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Applied online then received an email to set up an in-person interview few weeks later. Interviewed with the Marketing Coordinator and the out-going Marketing Student Manager. The interview ranged from personality based and exploratory questions to position specific questions regarding marketing and branding. The overall interview took about an hour with a hypothetical scenario exercise which is meant to be done on the spot. This hypothetical scenario has now changed where candidates are told beforehand what to prepare. Overall, the experience was a positive one, the length of the interview can be tiring but the interviewers put forth as much effort as you exhibit. Relax, be yourself and take your time in your answers.
Interview Questions: Here's a stack of post-its, sell them to us. What's your marketing strategy for them?

title: Programmer III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: I received their call to interview 1 week after applying for this job.  The Interview was about 20 questions.  The interview was conducted by 5 people.  The main Interview person was good, but the other people didn't seem competent.  One of the panel person was drawing flowers on his paper instead of writing notes about interview.
Interview Questions: The questions were easy.  Not very technical questions

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Sent an email applying for the position. got an email saying the prof wants to meet me. had basic questions about the course
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: I got this job as a condition of my admittance to graduate school - I was offered 5 years of support as a PhD student. There was no interview involved, but I submitted transcripts, letters of recommendation, test scores, personal statements etc.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to go to graduate school

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I met with my perspective boss and the current lab members.  I met with each member of the lab for 15-30 minutes to discuss their work, my work and how we may work together.  I later went to lunch with the entire lab at an on-campus restaurant.  I also presented by doctoral work for the group in an informal meeting.  At the end of the day I sat down with the PI and discussed possible projects that I would be involved with, if I were to join the lab.
Interview Questions: To describe previous work.

title: Student Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Found on Aggie Job Link, one interview
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with mundane, repetitive tasks?

title: Student Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed and conversational interview. Typical interview to see career and education plans and goals.
Interview Questions: Is money absolutely necessary?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very rigorous, went through three separate interviews. Met about 15 people in total. each person asks a series of questions. Took an hour long. Had a second panel interview with 10 people in the department and got the job.
Interview Questions: Have you ever been in a situation where you and your immediate supervisor do not get along and how do you handle it?

title: Producer/Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with a panel, 4 people in the department, one from anther department. I was asked mostly technical questions, but then some about my experience and working style. The interview was scripted, all the questions were pre-written, and the same questions were asked of all candidates. I heard back a week later.
Interview Questions: Most difficult questions were the technical questions - very specific cases about audio-video special cases and scenarios.

title: Student Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: All three of my supervisors interviewed me, and had a paper with questions and asked me the questions off of it. They wrote notes on my responses. The questions were very general, like "tell me about a time where there was a problem and how did you solve it"
Interview Questions: Where there any moments when you did not like a certain job?

title: Media Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview; asked about different experiences in media development, including video editing, Adobe photoshop, Adobe illustrator, etc. Also asked about availability, and willingness to travel. The person who interviewed me was very nice and understanding about me working as a part time student. Willingness to be flexible during finals week and midterms weeks, and scheduling around classes and school.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience in video and photo editing?

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Davis
Interview Descriptions: It asked the basic questions and few behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Why should we choose you?

title: Student Assistant II/Student Telephone Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submitted online PDF application and was called back the same day for a single phone interview. Hiring manager was very personable and easy to talk to. Asked straight forward questions. Following training program was time consuming but they were willing to work around people's schedules so long as they're given advanced notice.
Interview Questions: Have you ever been late to your previous work?

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was really good memory. The professor was very interested in my research and he asked another big name professor join my job talk and they both were very nice
Interview Questions: How long can you commit to the job?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: A recruitment day filled with current student and faculty interviews. There was both a panel interview with faculty members as well as one on one interviews with faculty members of my choosing.
Interview Questions: What are your research interests

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very Informal. You will most of the time know the Professor prior to be hired. But if you do not be sure to read up on the work being asked of you prior to the interview. These interviews are often a feeling out process and how well you will work together...
Interview Questions: What kind of databases do you have experience using?

title: Lead Java Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position on their website. After a few days, they arranged a phone interview, which lasted about 30 minutes. The interview is technical oriented. The questions are mostly focused on Java, JSP and Spring MVC.
Interview Questions: How do you pass variables between two JSP pages and how do you do it between a controller servlet and a JSP page?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: There was actually no formal interview at all. I was required to take the American Chemical Society exam on generla chemistry and score well. After that, I was simply offered the job.
Interview Questions: I was asked for my availability, and they were a little last moment about making the exact assignments, so I guess that could be an issue for some people.

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: I responded to an online job advert and was invited for a skype interview a week or so later. This was a one-to-one interview with my prospective employer. It lasted 45 mins and was rather informal. We chatted over previous findings from the lab and the questions the lab was aiming to answer and how.
Interview Questions: To describe my lab experience.

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Friendly but at first can be intimidating. The building has to be let in through the inside, so you have to wait for someone to buzz you in. Then you wait for management to come out and you just sit there and have the interview. Quick and simple. Dress neat but formal is unnecessary, bring a notebook because taking notes of other important things you will need is a must.
Interview Questions: Give us an example of when you have to manage multiple problems at once. How did you manage it?

title: Ad Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Initial communication then two interviews. Had to start as an ad representative.
Interview Questions: How will you increase revenue.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: After some written correspondance with one of the scientists in the group (due to me being abroad), I interviewed with the head scientists of the unit and the other scientist that I would be working with the most. They were very friendly and made me feel relaxed,
Interview Questions: This was an unpaid position, so there was less pressure. We discussed my interests and their projects and had a good dialoge on how these aligned and how to best use me for the time period I would be there.

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Not much. I met with the PI for a brief meeting, talked about the project, and then got an email a week or so later with my salary and benefits.
Interview Questions: I really don't remember. There weren't really any questions.

title: Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Had a quick interview/chat about the position in May. Went through application process and interview with a few of the staff there in the summer. Interview consisted of mostly behavioral questions and questions about my previous experiences
Interview Questions: normal behavioral questions

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: basic, answer a couple questions
Interview Questions: what super hero would you be?

title: Student Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Mass Interview. Luck of the draw if you were sent to Bio Brew (or a cool job) or the DC. They however are chronically short-staffed so they accept applications continuously and are very likely to accept anyone.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Member Services Attendant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: group interview. Way over board and selective for what was actually required on the job. Panel of 4 people who have worked at the ARC for a little while and they asked each person the same question going down the line with who started last time. I believe there were a total of 6 questions. All standard interview questions, what has prepared you, how can you help, etc.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Professional process.  Asked 10-15 questions about your graphic design experience.  Asked to show your portfolio at the end.  Very standard interview.
Interview Questions: Branding is a huge concept.  Understand that and you will flourish.

title: Program Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial panel interview with 3-5 people - the director, a Human Resources representative was present, and 1-2 employees from various departments. It took about 1.5 months after applying to receive a call for an interview. I was called an invited back for a second, panel interview after about 1.5 weeks. I was offered the position and scheduled for new hire orientation.
Interview Questions: If you were hosting a class, and the instructor called you and shared they would not be able to make it to teach due to an emergency, how would you handle the situation (considering the students that you were anticipating would be attending the course)?

title: Lab Specialist Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Asked about my previous research project and specifics about my project, friendly interview with the PI. Asked about my career goals and availability. short in duration 20-30 mins.
Interview Questions: What do you know about my research in the Lab?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was not hard at all.
Interview Questions: There was none other than about experience related to the job.

title: Student Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Will you have transportation to work? If so how? 
How can you handle multiple tasks at the same time?
What is your typing speed? 
How would you handle work and school (and internship)...knowing you need to work 15 hours a week?
Interview Questions: How do you feel about a boss who doesn't know the steps of your job?

title: Analyst IV Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions:
You have to apply online through their portal. Then I got an call to set up the interview. I passed the first interview. The usual questions, nothing hard. The second interview went bad from the start. The manager didn't like ... something. How I looked maybe. 

Very driven by the process, not driving the process. You could tell they were checking boxes (yes, i did this. Yes, I did that. etc.)
Interview Questions: the usual, nothing fancy.

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Easy and straightforward, more of a getting to know you than actual interview. Talked with multipled professors and met other students in the department. The interview lasted a few hours and I learned a lot about the school and department.
Interview Questions: What programs are you interested in?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: This process varies from department to department. As an admitted PhD student, you set up informal meetings with professors you're interested in working for. They describe projects available and what types of backgrounds they're looking for. This process is pretty informal and you typically come to a verbal agreement after deciding. At a faculty meeting, official placements are decided upon, but this usually follows the informal verbal agreements.
Interview Questions: What type of lab experience do you have?

title: AA III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: The best way to get into the UC System is through their TES (Temp. Employment Services).  Once in you have a better shot at a career position.  It took over 24 applications while temping to get an interview.  The whole process takes time -
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Davis (Sacramento, CA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview very professional, questions were from HR dept, given a point system. There were 6 people on the panel and each person asked a question. At the end you ask your questions. Took approximately 1 hr
Interview Questions: Give me an example of a conflict you had with either a surgeon, manager or co-worker

title: Student Assistant II Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Asked about how to properly advise students under different scenarios.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you had to help a student and a supervisor at the same time?

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: In person interview with Director. The Assistant Director was also present. It was casual. They asked lots of questions from my resume and allowed me to ask some questions about the position as well. The interview wasn't too difficult and took about thirty minutes.
Interview Questions: How would you help a student needing research advice?

title: First Year Experience Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and then had a phone screen.  The phone screen was very quick and straightforward.  After that I came in to do an in-person interview.  I met with a full-time employee as well as a supervisor (who was a student).  Although it was a group interview, I enjoyed interviewing with another student.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my past job experiences and how they would help me advise students in the future.

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a one-on-one interview with one member of the management team. A series of questions were posed both literal (i.e. testing your knowledge of the filed your applying to) and hypothetical situational questions. The questions were all simple and straightforward and the interview lasted no more than 20-30 minutes. The atmosphere was on of calm and not nerve inducing fear.
Interview Questions: It is late at night, with a storm raging outside and the power goes out. The building is full of students and management is gone home for the day. You are the only person in charge. What do you do?

title: Student Mechanic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was contacted for an onsite interview. During my interview the head mechanic asked what I was majoring in. After this he asked when I would be able to start. Haha. This concluded the hiring process. This is the easiest interview and hiring process you'll ever hear about.
Interview Questions: What are you majoring in?

title: Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Came into professors office, no formal questions were asked. Chatted about myself and my knowledge of the markets. After showing I was a friendly, normal human, capable of conversing, and slightly educated, I was offered the position on the spot. Professor just wanted to make sure I could complete the research.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Student Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty easy. I applied through Aggie Job Link and got a call within 2 weeks. There were 4 staff members who interviewed me. They gave me a sheet of paper of questions they would ask me and left me in a room to look through it for about 10 minutes before returning. The questions were mostly behavioral questions and situational questions. I heard back from them within the week of my interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time where you had to think on your feet.

title: Computer Resource Specialist II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Pretty simple and straight-forward, received an email an phone call, followed up and interviewed w/ the rest of the department (support department for a "cluster" of three academic departments.) and one faculty member. Everyone was pretty easy-going, friendly and helpful.
Interview Questions: What is your understanding of what a manager is supposed to do?

title: Ra Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Tell me about yourself.
What are your strengths?
What are your weaknesses?
Why do you want this job?
Where would you like to be in your career five years from now?
What's your ideal company?
What attracted you to this company?
Why should we hire you?
What did you like least about your last job?
When were you most satisfied in your job?
Interview Questions: what's maxwell equation

title: Computer Resource Specialist II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Got an email reply, called back, scheduled. My departmental situation was a bit unique, 3 different department recently joined in an Administrative Cluster, so were still working out who did what, so effectively had 3 managers and a faculty member there for the interview. Also had an on-the-spot "this computer won't boot/get on the network/print" skills test, which I appreciated.
Interview Questions: On a desktop running OSX, how would you troubleshoot a problem with a user getting their email?

title: Computer Desktop Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: there was a panel interview held by faculty, each person took a turn asking what ever questions they felt like, the interview felt very unstructured. I also felt like that the people asking questions were asking things outside the scope of the job posted for hire.
Interview Questions: describe your last job

title: Staff Research Associate I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: There was only one interview. It was a panel interview so there were about eight of the staff interviewing me. The staff who were involved in the interview include the Primary Investigators, and other management staff. They asked questions from a pre-printed list that they had, and only strayed from that list for me to further explain an answer I gave to them. They did not really react positively or negatively when I was being interviewed.
Interview Questions: If you find a coworker who is going against procedure, what would you do?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UC Davis (Raleigh, NC) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: phone then office
Interview Questions: will i work overtime for free

title: Business Analyst Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: Why you want to work at Macy's. Brief rundown of resume.
Interview Questions: What suggestions would you offer for our website?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Sacramento, CA) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: Presentation and meeting with people in the department, very casual
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Cook Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: It was a pretty casual interview, they asked about experience and knowledge. They asked me to demonstrate my knowledge in some cooking terms, and conversions. It was my first job and I told them that, and they were willing to train me which is nice. They were very specific in the job duties and wanted me to know exactly what I was going to be doing.
Interview Questions: If you were only able to cook one thing for the rest of you life, what would it be?

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Email communications, phone interview. Depends on the funding situation
Interview Questions: One scientific question for my research project

title: Student Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Was Contacted by Marketing Manager, given three time slots and interviewed at the ARC although the office was located at the Memorial Union. 

Once there, I was interviewed by the current student marketing manager and the Faculty Manager. The interview was about 1.5 hours long, they had many questions regarding my past experiences, my resume, my portfolio and projects I've done. They also asked many scenario questions relating to my potential position and I brought past experiences to deal with it. 

Knowledge for the company and its branches is a must, and understanding what the role as well as what the company does for other units is important.
Interview Questions: They brought in past pieces and asked me to critique and judge them.

title: IT Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Davis (Sacramento, CA) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Big Panel, fairly disinterested members going through the motions
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: Human Resources Analyst - Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UC Davis (Davis, CA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: Formal interview w/7-member panel. Round table discussion with 22 questions. I was allowed to review the questions for 15 minutes prior to interview.  The interview was scheduled for 45-60 minutes but lasted 1 hr 20 min. Panel was serious but relaxed, questions moderate-difficult, interview ended in mutual laughter.
